intro: Batrachium triphyllum, commonly known as the three-leaved frog plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Commelinaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant's name refers to its unique leaf structure and its association with moist habitats.
